meanings.definition: Given to making jokes; inclined to joke.
meanings.sent1: She is always so joky, making everyone laugh with her funny stories.
meanings.sent2: His joky nature lightens up the mood in any situation.
meanings.sent3: The joky atmosphere at the party had everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: His joky remarks were like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The joky banter between friends created a warm and friendly vibe.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or full of jokes; humorous.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's performance was incredibly joky, leaving the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent2: Their joky banter kept the conversation light and enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: The joky movie had everyone laughing from start to finish.
meanings.sent4: Her joky sense of humor added a touch of fun to the gathering.
meanings.sent5: The joky tone of the book made it a delightful read for all ages.
